decks.notes: The deck focuses on assembling the combo piece Doomsday to strategically order your deck and win the game with either Thassa's Oracle or Jace, Wielder of Mysteries. It uses cards like Dark Ritual, Lotus Petal, and Lion's Eye Diamond to generate mana quickly, while also running disruption like Force of Will and Duress to protect the combo. Teferi, Time Raveler helps with setup and protection, and cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help dig for combo pieces. The deck aims to win the game quickly and efficiently once the combo is assembled.

The deck focuses on using Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill an opponent's entire library in one turn. It utilizes cards like Goblin Welder and Goblin Engineer to search for and recur combo pieces. The deck also includes disruption spells like Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast to protect the combo. Additionally, it uses fast mana acceleration with cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb to quickly assemble the combo. The inclusion of cards like Ensnaring Bridge and City of Traitors help to control the board and keep the opponent's threats at bay while executing the combo.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence with aggressive creatures and disrupting opponents' mana bases with cards like Magus of the Moon. By using mana acceleration cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide, the deck can play threats ahead of schedule and apply pressure early in the game. The inclusion of Minsc & Boo, Timeless Heroes provides additional value and threats. The deck aims to maintain the initiative and pressure opponents into making suboptimal plays while continuing to develop its own board.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty using cards like Entomb and Reanimate. It combines graveyard recursion spells with fast mana acceleration to cheat large creatures into play early in the game. The disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Unmask help protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes ways to deal with problematic permanents with cards like Wasteland. Overall, the deck aims to assemble a powerful board state and overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and disruptive spells.

This Dragon Stompy deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing powerful cards like Blood Moon and Chalice of the Void to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck aims to lock down opponents' mana bases while quickly ramping up its own board presence with dragons and other aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide, the deck can quickly deploy threats while maintaining a disruptive game plan. With a focus on quick aggression and disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents before they can fully develop their own game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly set up the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill an opponent's entire deck in one turn. The deck includes cards like Goblin Engineer to tutor for combo pieces, alongside disruptive spells like Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast to protect the combo. The use of cards like Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors allow for faster mana ramp, while cards like Urza's Saga and Vexing Bauble provide additional utility and card advantage. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker adds flexibility and synergy to the overall strategy.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while applying pressure with efficient creatures and spells. It uses a combination of permission spells like Force of Will and disruption spells like Thoughtseize to control the game, while utilizing efficient removal like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with threats. The deck also includes tempo cards like Daze and Brazen Borrower to keep the opponent on the back foot. Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf provide strong threats that can end the game quickly if left unchecked.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently disrupt and control the opponent's plays while deploying threats of its own. Utilizing a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and disruption like Stifle and Daze, it aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also features aggressive creatures like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf to close out the game quickly. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and utility, while Orcish Bowmasters and Psychic Frog offer additional disruption and tempo advantage. The mana base is designed for consistency and to support the deck's aggressive tempo strategy.

The deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays, utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt and Delver of Secrets to deal damage early on. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze to control the game tempo. The deck is able to generate card advantage through cards like Brainstorm and Mishra's Bauble, while also utilizing creatures like Nethergoyf and Dragon's Rage Channeler. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes dual lands like Volcanic Island and Underground Sea, along with strong utility lands like Wasteland.

The deck is centered around executing a powerful combo using Doomsday to set up a winning board state. It focuses on fast mana generation with cards like Lotus Petal and Dark Ritual, alongside disruption with Force of Will and Daze. The key win condition involves casting Doomsday to rearrange the top cards of the library in a way that allows Thassa's Oracle to win the game immediately. It also utilizes card draw and filtering with Brainstorm and Ponder to find combo pieces quickly, while maintaining interaction with powerful cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Fatal Push.
